message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the source of solar energy on Earth. The closest star to our planet is the sun, and it delivers solar energy to Earth through a process called nuclear fusion. Option (B) is incorrect because not all of the options are true - only option (A) is true. Option (C) is also incorrect because it is known that the sun is the closest star to our planet. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no uncertainty or "maybe" in this statement.

This question requires knowledge about our closest star, which is the sun, and its role in delivering solar energy to our planet. The statement is true, as the sun provides solar energy to Earth through a process called radiation. Option (B), (C), and (D) are all incorrect because they suggest uncertainty or additional possibilities, while the question is asking for a definitive answer.
